reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Environment - General is used when Environment sectors are unknown or foreign assistance is allocated to multiple sectors within this category.

This project focuses on the securement, management and stewardship of wetland and associated upland habitats that are critical to maintaining the region's breeding, staging and wintering waterfowl populations and other wetland-dependent wildlife. Workplan activities align with EHJV and NAWMP goals, and address trends and threats regarding wetlands and waterfowl identified in the State of Canada's Birds 2012 Report. Specifically, this project will secure 1,726 acres (628 wetland, 1098 upland) through acquisition, 184 acres (55 wetland, 129 upland) via conservation agreements, enhance 25 wetland acres, and manage 68,546 acres (19,700 wetland, 48,846 upland). Stewardship activities will also affect 510 acres (153 wetland, 357 upland).. This project is composed of securement activities that will occur on private lands at three locations in Coastal/maritime Québec (Mingan Archipelago, Magdalen Islands and Longue-Rive). Activities will occur near Nature Reserves, designated Wildlife Refuges or National Parks, and target habitat requirements of migratory bird species affected by the BP oil spill. Specifically, this project will protect 279 acres (182 wetland, 97 upland acres) of important North Atlantic coastal habitats in Eastern Quebec from drainage, conversion, development, and other critical threats. Habitats protected under this proposal will protect in perpetuity staging and/or breeding habitat for at least 5 species impacted by the BP oil spill across four sites, directly linked to the populations of affected species targeted in the proposal that migrate through or have wintering locations in the Gulf of Mexico region.
